messages.description:
This document describes Piccolo Communications API, version 2.1.4g in regard to the packet format for individual stream packets.
It *does not* describe the format of the global packet for the stream packet protocol.

types.description: Messages and packets can be viewed as a finite collection of fields. The list of valid field types is presented below. Please note that all fields are serialized in *big endian* byte order (aka "network byte order").

type.name: fp16_t
type.description: 16 bit precision floating point number, as a variation of IEEE 754 format. See Piccolo Communications document, page 23.

type.name: fp32_t
type.description: 32 bit single precision floating point number in IEEE 754 format.

type.name: fp64_t
type.description: 64 bit double precision floating point number in IEEE 754 format.

units.description: The following table lists the units used in the subsequent chapters.

description.p: The packet header contains handling information in the form of supplemental fields, it is always placed at the beginning of a packet.
For Piccolo 2.0.1 stream packets this includes the 0xA005 synchronization number, plus two unsigned 8-bit fields, one for the packet type, another for the packet size.

footer.description: The packet footer contains validation information in the form of supplemental fields, it is always placed at the end of a packet. For Piccolo 2.0.1 packets the footer contains a CRC-16 IBM checksum.

bitmask.name: Use GPS altitude if diff corrected
Assertion of flight termination causes the engine to be killed
Flight termination is asserted when airspace boundary is violated
Assertion of flight termination causes the deadman output to be dropped
Assertion of flight termination causes aerodynamic termination
Flight timer causes automatic landing in lost communications
Flight termination is asserted when the communications timeouts elapse
Flight termination is asserted when the GPS timeouts elapse
Flight termination is asserted when BOTH the GPS and the communications timeouts elapse

enum.name: Aileron stick is used for assist
Elevator stick is used for assist
All sticks are used for assist
Flies based on TASE gimbal orientation

bitmask.name: Dilution of precision, in units of 0.2 DOP
ETA to waypoint in seconds, if orbit is untimed this value is zero
